contentrichtext.text: '''Matthew of Westminster''', long regarded as the author of the ''[[Flores Historiarum]]'',<ref>{{cite CE1913|wstitle=Matthew of Westminster|volume=15}}</ref> is now thought never to have existed. The error was first discovered in 1826 by [[Francis Turner Palgrave]], who said that Matthew was "a phantom who never existed," and later the truth of this statement was completely proved by [[Henry Richards Luard]]. The name appears to have been taken from that of [[Matthew Paris]], from whose ''Chronica majora'' the earlier part of the work was mainly copied, and from [[Westminster Abbey]], where the work was partially written. ==References== {{reflist}} ;Attribution {{1911}} [[Category:Medieval writers]]
